title: Helping Your Kids Identify Their Strengths
itunes:author: Guest: Brandon & Analyn Miller
itunes:summary:
Brandon and Analyn Miller admit to early parenting challenges – believing their kids were supposed to make them look good as parents. But then they discovered the power of strengths-based parenting, where you identify and encourage areas where your kids excel, rather than focus on their areas of weakness.


Receive the book "Play to Their Strengths" and the audio download of the broadcast "Helping Your Kids Identify Their Strengths" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-daily-broadcast-product-2022-10-21?refcd=1499802


Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/broadcast/helping-your-kids-identify-their-strengths/#featured-resource-cta


If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

Brandon and Analyn Miller admit to early parenting challenges – believing their kids were supposed to make them look good as parents. But then they discovered the power of strengths-based parenting, where you identify and encourage areas where your kids excel, rather than focus on their areas of weakness.
